This emoji is displayed from the side, as opposed to the oncoming police car emoji, which is shownÂ from the front.
components.title: Police Car

description:
A police car, shown with an emergency light on the top.

This emoji is displayed from the side, as opposed to the oncoming police car emoji, which is shownÂ from the front.
title: Police Car

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.definition: A police car, shown with an emergency light on the top. This emoji is displayed from the side, as opposed to the oncoming police car emoji,  http://emojipedia.org/police-car/
emoji_net_data.name: police car

bn:00091483v: Maintain the security of by carrying out a patrol

bn:00084831v: To pursue, to follow at speed.
To follow at speed with the intent to catch.
To follow behind (someone or something); to tail (someone or something).
To follow urgently, originally with intent to capture or harm; to chase.
Go after with the intent to catch
To pursue with the intent to catch.

bn:00024126n: A vehicle used by a police officer when on duty.
A police car is a ground vehicle used by police, to assist with their duties in patrolling and responding to incidents.
A car in which policemen cruise the streets; equipped with radiotelephonic communications to headquarters

bn:00022026n: A police force is a constituted body of persons empowered by the state to enforce the law, protect property, and limit civil disorder.
A civil force granted the legal authority to enforce the law and maintain public order.
Constabulary may have several definitions: A civil, non-paramilitary force consisting of police officers called constables.
Branch of the government which is charged with the preservation of public order, the promotion of public health and safety, and the prevention, detection, and punishment of crimes.
The force of policemen and officers
Constituted body of persons empowered by the state to enforce the law
An organisation that enforces the law.
With `old bill' as a slang term in the UK

bn:00048655n: The collection of rules imposed by authority
System of rules and guidelines, generally backed by governmental authority
Body of rules from the legislative authority.
Law is, generally, a system of rules which are enforced through social institutions to govern behavior.
A body of rules of action or conduct prescribed by a legislative authority, and having binding legal force.
The body of rules and standards issued by a government, or to be applied by courts and similar authorities.
Law is a term referring to sociological or scientific norms, or systems and expressions based upon them.

bn:00007309n: A motor vehicle with four wheels; usually propelled by an internal combustion engine
A car is a wheeled, self-powered motor vehicle used for transportation.

A type of vehicle designed to move on the ground under its own stored power and intended to carry a driver, a small number of additional passengers, and a very limited amount of other load. A car or motorcar.
A four-wheeled motor vehicle used for land transport.
Automobile, a vehicle steered by a driver.
A wheeled vehicle, drawn by a horse or other animal.
Wheeled motor vehicle used for transporting passengers
